alert.note: Alert for Grand Isle; Western Chittenden (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 23 at 9:47AM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of eastern Clinton, northeastern Essex, western Grand Isle and northwestern Chittenden Counties through 1045 AM EDT... At 946 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Beekmantown. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Moderate to heavy rainfall of 1 to 1.5 inches has fallen over the last 6 hours. An additional 0.5 to 1.25 inches is expected. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Ponding of water on road surfaces may lead to conditions where hydroplaning could occur. Area creeks, streams, and rivers are running faster than usual and may be approaching thier banks. Locations impacted include... Plattsburgh International Airport, Plattsburgh, Peru, Beekmantown, Schuyler Falls, Chazy, Mooers, Alburgh Village, Champlain, Isle La Motte, Rouses Point, Alburgh, South Hero, Grand Isle, North Hero, Colchester, Young Island, Wilcox Point, Scott Point and Hazen Point. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
